code:

  description: "Select any animal to view its details."

  img_url: "../images/lion.png",
  bg_color: "#ffa21c",
  description: "The lion is a species in the family Felidae; it is a muscular, deep-chested cat with a short, rounded head, a reduced neck and round ears, and a hairy tuft at the end of its tail. It is sexually dimorphic; male lions have a prominent mane, which is the most recognisable feature of the species.",
  lifespan: "10 – 14 years",
  speed: "Up to 80 km/h",
  weight: "Male: 190 kg (Adult), Female: 130 kg (Adult)",
  facts: ["A lion may sleep up to 20 hours a day.", "A lion’s heels don’t touch the ground when it walks.", "In West Africa, fewer than 250 adult lions remain.", "A lion can run for short distances at 50 mph and leap as far as 36 feet.", "A lion’s roar can be heard from as far as 5 miles away."]
}, {
  id: "elephant",
  title: "Elephant",
  img_url: "../images/elephant.png",
  bg_color: "#d2e8f2",
  description: "Elephants, the largest existing land animals, are mammals of the family Elephantidae. Three species are currently recognised: the African bush elephant, the African forest elephant, and the Asian elephant. Elephantidae is the only surviving family of the order Proboscidea; extinct members include the mastodons.",
  lifespan: "48 - 70 years",
  speed: "Up to 40 km/h",
  weight: "2700 - 6000 kg",
  facts: ["Elephant families are led by females", "Elephants are highly sensitive and caring animals. If a baby Elephant complain, the entire family will go over to touch and caress it to soothe it.", "All baby Elephants are born blind, but they can stand up almost immediately.", "An Elephant’s tusk will continue to grow throughout its lifetime. An adult male’s tusk will grow about 7 inches each year on average.", "Elephants have an extremely slow pulse rate, around 27 beats per minute. Compare that to the average human (80 bpm), or Canary (1000 bpm)."]
}, {
  id: "owl",
  title: "Owl",
  img_url: "../images/owl.png",
  bg_color: "#d6cc9e",
  description: "Owls are birds from the order Strigiformes, which includes about 200 species of mostly solitary and nocturnal birds of prey typified by an upright stance, a large, broad head, binocular vision, binaural hearing, sharp talons, and feathers adapted for silent flight.",
  lifespan: "4 years",
  speed: "Up to 80 km/h",
  weight: "400 gm - 2.7 kg",
  facts: ["The color of owl’s feathers helps them blend into their environment (camouflage).", "There are around 200 different owl species.", "Owls can turn their heads as much as 270 degrees.", "Owls are farsighted, meaning they can’t see things close to their eyes clearly."]
}, {
  id: "tiger",
  title: "Tiger",
  img_url: "../images/tiger.png",
  bg_color: "#d64e00",
  description: "The tiger is the largest species among the Felidae and classified in the genus Panthera. It is most recognisable for its dark vertical stripes on reddish-orange fur with a lighter underside. It is an apex predator, primarily preying on ungulates such as deer and wild boar.",
  lifespan: "16 – 18 years",
  speed: "Up to 49 – 65 km/h",
  weight: "Male: 90 – 310 kg (Adult), Female: 65 – 170 kg (Adult)",
  facts: ["An adult tiger can go for up to two weeks without eating, then gorge on 34 kg (75 lb) of flesh at one time.", "Tigers are the largest cat species in the world and the third-largest carnivore on land after polar and brown bears.", "Tigers are the only cat species that are completely striped. They even have stripes on their skin.", "A tiger's tail is about three feet long and helps them balance when making tight turns.", "You can hear a tiger's roar from up to two miles away. Tiger vocalizations include roaring, growling, hissing, moaning and chuffing."]
}, {
  id: "bear",
  title: "Bear",
  img_url: "../images/bear.png",
  bg_color: "#ffe0b5",
  description: "Bears are carnivoran mammals of the family Ursidae. They are classified as caniforms, or doglike carnivorans. Although only eight species of bears are extant, they are widespread, appearing in a wide variety of habitats throughout the Northern Hemisphere and partially in the Southern Hemisphere.",
  lifespan: "20 years",
  speed: "Up to 40 km/h",
  weight: "70 - 450 kg",
  facts: ["In 2012, a family of bears ransacked a cabin in northern Norway and guzzled 100 cans of beer.", "Canada is home to nearly 60 % of the world’s polar bears.", "Baloo, from The Jungle Book, is a sloth bear.", "Bears have a large brain and are also known as intelligent mammals.", "Bears have an excellent sense of smell, better than dogs."]
}, {
  id: "rabbit",
  title: "Rabbit",
  img_url: "../images/bunny.png",
  bg_color: "#9bc6ba",
  description: "Rabbits are small mammals in the family Leporidae of the order Lagomorpha. Oryctolagus cuniculus includes the European rabbit species and its descendants, the world's 305 breeds of domestic rabbit. Sylvilagus includes 13 wild rabbit species, among them the 7 types of cottontail.",
  lifespan: "1 - 2 years",
  speed: "Up to 70 km/h",
  weight: "700 gm - 3 kg",
  facts: ["More than half of the world's rabbits live in North America.", "It's hard to sneak up on a rabbit: Their vision covers nearly 360 degrees, which allows them to see what's coming from behind them, above them, and from the sides without turning their heads.", "Like human fingernails, a rabbit's teeth will keep growing if given the chance.", "The oversized ears also have the added benefit of cooling rabbits down on a hot day."]
}, {
  id: "hippo",
  title: "Hippopotamus",
  img_url: "../images/hippo.png",
  bg_color: "#e6c5d0",
  description: 'The common hippopotamus, or hippo, is a large, mostly herbivorous, semiaquatic mammal and ungulate native to sub-Saharan Africa. It is one of only two extant species in the family Hippopotamidae, the other being the pygmy hippopotamus. The name comes from the ancient Greek for "river horse".',
  lifespan: "40 - 50 years",
  speed: "Up to 30 km/h",
  weight: "1300 - 1800 kg",
  facts: ["Hippos are third largest living land mammal, after elephants and white rhinos.", "An adult Hippo needs to resurface every 3 – 5mins to breathe. The process of surfacing and breathing is automatic, and even a hippo sleeping underwater will rise and breathe without waking.", "The hippopotamus is one of the most aggressive creatures in the world and is often regarded as one of the most dangerous animals in Africa.", "The name Hippopotamus comes from the Ancient Greek ‘river horse’."]
}, {
  id: "giraffe",
  title: "Giraffe",
  img_url: "../images/giraffe.png",
  bg_color: "#ffe083",
  description: "The giraffe is an African even-toed ungulate mammal, the tallest living terrestrial animal and the largest ruminant. It is traditionally considered to be one species, Giraffa camelopardalis, with nine subspecies.",
  lifespan: "25 years",
  speed: "Up to 60 km/h",
  weight: "800 kg",
  facts: ["A giraffe's neck is too short to reach the ground, so it has to awkwardly spread its front legs or kneel to reach the ground and drink water.", "Giraffes only need to drink once every few days. Most of their water comes from all the plants they eat.", "Giraffes spend most of their lives standing up; they even sleep and give birth standing up.", "Giraffes only need 5 to 30 minutes of sleep in a 24-hour period! They often achieve that in quick naps that may last only a minute or two at a time.", "Giraffes are the tallest mammals on Earth. Their legs alone are taller than many humans—about 6 feet."]
}];

sourcesContent:
export const intro = {
  title: "Welcome to the Zoo!!!",
  description: "Select any animal to view its details."
};

export const list = [
  {
    id: "lion",
    title: "Lion",
    img_url: "../images/lion.png",
    bg_color: "#ffa21c",
    description:
      "The lion is a species in the family Felidae; it is a muscular, deep-chested cat with a short, rounded head, a reduced neck and round ears, and a hairy tuft at the end of its tail. It is sexually dimorphic; male lions have a prominent mane, which is the most recognisable feature of the species.",
    lifespan: "10 – 14 years",
    speed: "Up to 80 km/h",
    weight: "Male: 190 kg (Adult), Female: 130 kg (Adult)",
    facts: [
      "A lion may sleep up to 20 hours a day.",
      "A lion’s heels don’t touch the ground when it walks.",
      "In West Africa, fewer than 250 adult lions remain.",
      "A lion can run for short distances at 50 mph and leap as far as 36 feet.",
      "A lion’s roar can be heard from as far as 5 miles away."
    ]
  },
  {
    id: "elephant",
    title: "Elephant",
    img_url: "../images/elephant.png",
    bg_color: "#d2e8f2",
    description:
      "Elephants, the largest existing land animals, are mammals of the family Elephantidae. Three species are currently recognised: the African bush elephant, the African forest elephant, and the Asian elephant. Elephantidae is the only surviving family of the order Proboscidea; extinct members include the mastodons.",
    lifespan: "48 - 70 years",
    speed: "Up to 40 km/h",
    weight: "2700 - 6000 kg",
    facts: [
      "Elephant families are led by females",
      "Elephants are highly sensitive and caring animals. If a baby Elephant complain, the entire family will go over to touch and caress it to soothe it.",
      "All baby Elephants are born blind, but they can stand up almost immediately.",
      "An Elephant’s tusk will continue to grow throughout its lifetime. An adult male’s tusk will grow about 7 inches each year on average.",
      "Elephants have an extremely slow pulse rate, around 27 beats per minute. Compare that to the average human (80 bpm), or Canary (1000 bpm)."
    ]
  },
  {
    id: "owl",
    title: "Owl",
    img_url: "../images/owl.png",
    bg_color: "#d6cc9e",
    description:
      "Owls are birds from the order Strigiformes, which includes about 200 species of mostly solitary and nocturnal birds of prey typified by an upright stance, a large, broad head, binocular vision, binaural hearing, sharp talons, and feathers adapted for silent flight.",
    lifespan: "4 years",
    speed: "Up to 80 km/h",
    weight: "400 gm - 2.7 kg",
    facts: [
      "The color of owl’s feathers helps them blend into their environment (camouflage).",
      "There are around 200 different owl species.",
      "Owls can turn their heads as much as 270 degrees.",
      "Owls are farsighted, meaning they can’t see things close to their eyes clearly."
    ]
  },
  {
    id: "tiger",
    title: "Tiger",
    img_url: "../images/tiger.png",
    bg_color: "#d64e00",
    description:
      "The tiger is the largest species among the Felidae and classified in the genus Panthera. It is most recognisable for its dark vertical stripes on reddish-orange fur with a lighter underside. It is an apex predator, primarily preying on ungulates such as deer and wild boar.",
    lifespan: "16 – 18 years",
    speed: "Up to 49 – 65 km/h",
    weight: "Male: 90 – 310 kg (Adult), Female: 65 – 170 kg (Adult)",
    facts: [
      "An adult tiger can go for up to two weeks without eating, then gorge on 34 kg (75 lb) of flesh at one time.",
      "Tigers are the largest cat species in the world and the third-largest carnivore on land after polar and brown bears.",
      "Tigers are the only cat species that are completely striped. They even have stripes on their skin.",
      "A tiger's tail is about three feet long and helps them balance when making tight turns.",
      "You can hear a tiger's roar from up to two miles away. Tiger vocalizations include roaring, growling, hissing, moaning and chuffing."
    ]
  },
  {
    id: "bear",
    title: "Bear",
    img_url: "../images/bear.png",
    bg_color: "#ffe0b5",
    description:
      "Bears are carnivoran mammals of the family Ursidae. They are classified as caniforms, or doglike carnivorans. Although only eight species of bears are extant, they are widespread, appearing in a wide variety of habitats throughout the Northern Hemisphere and partially in the Southern Hemisphere.",
    lifespan: "20 years",
    speed: "Up to 40 km/h",
    weight: "70 - 450 kg",
    facts: [
      "In 2012, a family of bears ransacked a cabin in northern Norway and guzzled 100 cans of beer.",
      "Canada is home to nearly 60 % of the world’s polar bears.",
      "Baloo, from The Jungle Book, is a sloth bear.",
      "Bears have a large brain and are also known as intelligent mammals.",
      "Bears have an excellent sense of smell, better than dogs."
    ]
  },
  {
    id: "rabbit",
    title: "Rabbit",
    img_url: "../images/bunny.png",
    bg_color: "#9bc6ba",
    description:
      "Rabbits are small mammals in the family Leporidae of the order Lagomorpha. Oryctolagus cuniculus includes the European rabbit species and its descendants, the world's 305 breeds of domestic rabbit. Sylvilagus includes 13 wild rabbit species, among them the 7 types of cottontail.",
    lifespan: "1 - 2 years",
    speed: "Up to 70 km/h",
    weight: "700 gm - 3 kg",
    facts: [
      "More than half of the world's rabbits live in North America.",
      "It's hard to sneak up on a rabbit: Their vision covers nearly 360 degrees, which allows them to see what's coming from behind them, above them, and from the sides without turning their heads.",
      "Like human fingernails, a rabbit's teeth will keep growing if given the chance.",
      "The oversized ears also have the added benefit of cooling rabbits down on a hot day."
    ]
  },
  {
    id: "hippo",
    title: "Hippopotamus",
    img_url: "../images/hippo.png",
    bg_color: "#e6c5d0",
    description:
      'The common hippopotamus, or hippo, is a large, mostly herbivorous, semiaquatic mammal and ungulate native to sub-Saharan Africa. It is one of only two extant species in the family Hippopotamidae, the other being the pygmy hippopotamus. The name comes from the ancient Greek for "river horse".',
    lifespan: "40 - 50 years",
    speed: "Up to 30 km/h",
    weight: "1300 - 1800 kg",
    facts: [
      "Hippos are third largest living land mammal, after elephants and white rhinos.",
      "An adult Hippo needs to resurface every 3 – 5mins to breathe. The process of surfacing and breathing is automatic, and even a hippo sleeping underwater will rise and breathe without waking.",
      "The hippopotamus is one of the most aggressive creatures in the world and is often regarded as one of the most dangerous animals in Africa.",
      "The name Hippopotamus comes from the Ancient Greek ‘river horse’."
    ]
  },
  {
    id: "giraffe",
    title: "Giraffe",
    img_url: "../images/giraffe.png",
    bg_color: "#ffe083",
    description:
      "The giraffe is an African even-toed ungulate mammal, the tallest living terrestrial animal and the largest ruminant. It is traditionally considered to be one species, Giraffa camelopardalis, with nine subspecies.",
    lifespan: "25 years",
    speed: "Up to 60 km/h",
    weight: "800 kg",
    facts: [
      "A giraffe's neck is too short to reach the ground, so it has to awkwardly spread its front legs or kneel to reach the ground and drink water.",
      "Giraffes only need to drink once every few days. Most of their water comes from all the plants they eat.",
      "Giraffes spend most of their lives standing up; they even sleep and give birth standing up.",
      "Giraffes only need 5 to 30 minutes of sleep in a 24-hour period! They often achieve that in quick naps that may last only a minute or two at a time.",
      "Giraffes are the tallest mammals on Earth. Their legs alone are taller than many humans—about 6 feet."
    ]
  }
];
